author: Abhinav Malhotra
title: Sanath Jayasuriya to grace IIT-Kanpur's annual sports festival
text:
KANPUR: Sanath Jayasuriya, the former cricket player of Sri Lankan team will grace this year's Udgosh-the annual sports festival of IIT Kanpur, slated to begin from October 1.
Jayasuriya will be chief guest for the occasion on the closing ceremony of Udgosh on October 4. It is for the first time in Udgosh that an international player will give away the medals and prizes to the winners. During the Udgosh event, 600 medals and 400 trophies will be given away to the winners.
This time it will be Udgosh's 13th edition for which the preparations had almost completed. Like every year this time too, sporting events like athletics, cricket, football, basketball, volleyball, tennis etc will be held during this sports fest. As many as 1800 outstation candidates from 50 colleges including IITs, IIMs, Delhi and Mumbai universities and others will be participating in the competitions.
Festival co-ordinator of Udgosh, Vipul Garg informed that on the opening night, band named 'the local train' will perform which is causing waves in the Indian rock fraternity. He said that the fest will mark its start with the formal inauguration by director of the institute.
He said that the second evening will witness a bike stunts show by 'Ghost Riders'. This is for the first time that the bike stunt show will be held. On the third night, a concert of ace singer Nikhil D'Souza will be held which will mesmerise the students and the outstation candidates.
On the last day of the fest, a marathon supporting the cause of the fest 'AIDS awareness' will be conducted during the morning hours.
Apart from the events like athletics, cricket, football, basketball, powerlifting, weightlifting, taekwondo, tennis, squash, table tennis, carrom, chess, hockey, the major attractions would be burma-bridge, zip-line, zorbing, counter-strike, rappling, shooting, archery, crossbow, cross-pistol and wall-climbing.
Shweta Srivastava, the head of media and publicity of Udgosh informed that for the first time the 'Kho-Kho' event will be held for both the boys and girls this year. Last year Kho-Kho was held for boys only. She said that the competitions will begin at 8 in the morning on October 1 but the formal inauguration of the program will be held during the evening hours. She also mentioned that the total festival budget is of Rs 60 lakhs and event has been raised with the help of 50 sponsors.
The team Udgosh has decided that the best player of each sporting competition will be given a momento.
Apart from these, there will be plethora of informal activities lined up to make everyone's stay at Udgosh fun filled and enjoyable. This year a professional poker competition with prizes worth Rs 2 lakh has been organised during Udgosh, said Prasant Chanti, the media and publicity head.
